programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special Ep17
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look at some of our favourite stories from the Pacific. In PNG Betel nut traders risk their lives to make an income, Tahiti's ancient art of Tatau, and we hear from renowned Solomon Islands musician Charles Maimarosia.

programme.title: Wildest Pacific Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Set amongst the jungle-lined islands of the Coral Triangle's bays are the calm azure waters. Centuries of seismic activity have lined them with volcanic ash. These 'muck zones' have borne some intriguing marine adaptations.

programme.title: Decoding Danger Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Australia is shaped by great storms, extreme heat, and an epic cycle of boom and bust. Life on the island continent has evolved accordingly, to survive drought and flooding rains. How can we learn to survive and thrive?

programme.title: China Tonight: Summer Special Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Sam Yang and Annie Louey take a look back at more of our favourite stories from China Tonight in 2023, exploring how technology and culture are changing the face of modern day China.

programme.title: Fancy Fruit Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - They're a mystery to many, but jujubes have been around for thousands of years. Like a small apple or date, they can be eaten fresh or dried. One Australian producer is investing in a big way with plans for export.

programme.title: The Dark Emu Story
programme.desc: A thought-provoking and inspiring documentary that charts the impact of Bruce Pascoe's Dark Emu - the publishing phenomenon that challenged Australia to rethink its history and ignited a debate that continues to rage.

programme.title: Aussie Bull Catchers Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - The Cooks double down on their investment with a helicopter. Kurt Hammar's son Kodi leaves school to become a bull catcher. After a nasty spider bite and medical help miles away, Clarry's worker resorts to an old bush remedy.

programme.title: The Homes That Built Australia Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Cyclones, floods, droughts; the all-mighty forces of nature devastate our homes and lives, showing how we must design and work with the land - or ignore it at our own peril.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep38
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa gives garden bed gifts; Jane explores a florist's paradise; Millie sets up for summer success; Tammy creates beautiful living wreaths; Clarence learns about Christmas beetles; and Hannah meets a family of berry farmers.

programme.title: Alone Australia Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - After ten days in the Tasmanian wilderness, just five participants remain. Having survived the settling in period, each is now focussed on their own strategies, which they hope will see them outstay the others.

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Australia Unmasked Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Miriam Margolyes travels through Victoria, attending polo matches and bogan burnouts, to explore what class looks like in Australia and how much it shapes our expectations and opportunities.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The remarkable story of a woman taking part in Australia's first psychedelic-assisted therapy trial. For Lindy Bok, it's a profound and deeply emotional experience as the treatment helps her confront anxiety around death.

programme.title: Anh's Brush With Fame Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 5 - Adman and adventurer Todd Sampson shares the pivotal moments that have shaped his life, taking him from small town Canada to advertising success and beyond. Can Anh capture his fearless determination and thirst for life?

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep102
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: Alone Australia Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - After ten days in the Tasmanian wilderness, just five participants remain. Having survived the settling in period, each is now focussed on their own strategies, which they hope will see them outstay the others.

programme.title: Going Places With Ernie Dingo Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 3 - Ernie escapes to the charming town of Winton where he meets the founder of a dinosaur museum, takes flight above the outback with a pilot and spends an afternoon painting with a skilled artist.

programme.title: Regional Roundup Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look at some of the top regional stories in 2023. A string of arson attacks has authorities on edge, that sinking feeling as a rural retreat is ruined by a sinkhole, and an Aussie entertainer looking to crack the big time.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Young people from all across Australia share their personal stories of growing up in regional Australia, as we bring you the best short films from the 2023 Heywire project. Hosted by Isaac Muller.

programme.title: The Business: Summer Special Ep182
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - From PwC to Optus and Qantas, corporate Australia faced a reckoning in 2023. In this special summer episode of The Business, Kirsten Aiken looks back at the stories that rocked corporate Australia in the past year.

programme.title: The World This Week Ep49
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Beverley O'Connor brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents across Europe, North America, the Middle East, and the Indo-Pacific. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Australian Story Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The remarkable story of a woman taking part in Australia's first psychedelic-assisted therapy trial. For Lindy Bok, it's a profound and deeply emotional experience as the treatment helps her confront anxiety around death.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep38
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa gives garden bed gifts; Jane explores a florist's paradise; Millie sets up for summer success; Tammy creates beautiful living wreaths; Clarence learns about Christmas beetles; and Hannah meets a family of berry farmers.

programme.title: Landline Summer Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - This summer, we look back at some of the best Landline stories from 2023. How different communities are managing the Darling River in flood, plus Tasmania's wool growing maverick doing things her way.

programme.title: Back Roads: Great Australian Pubs Special Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 9 - In this special 100th episode of Back Roads, Heather Ewart looks at The Great Australian Pub. Our very own unique style of watering hole, the humble pub sits at the heart of many communities.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast Ep52
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Ease into your Sunday with an engaging mix of news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics and weather. Presented by Fauziah Ibrahim and Ruby Cornish, plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special Ep17
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look at some of our favourite stories from the Pacific. In PNG Betel nut traders risk their lives to make an income, Tahiti's ancient art of Tatau, and we hear from renowned Solomon Islands musician Charles Maimarosia.

programme.title: ABC News Ep103
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Stephanie Borys presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: Regional Roundup Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look at some of the top regional stories in 2023. A string of arson attacks has authorities on edge, that sinking feeling as a rural retreat is ruined by a sinkhole, and an Aussie entertainer looking to crack the big time.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep103
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Stephanie Borys presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep38
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa gives garden bed gifts; Jane explores a florist's paradise; Millie sets up for summer success; Tammy creates beautiful living wreaths; Clarence learns about Christmas beetles; and Hannah meets a family of berry farmers.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Young people from all across Australia share their personal stories of growing up in regional Australia, as we bring you the best short films from the 2023 Heywire project. Hosted by Isaac Muller.

programme.title: ABC News Ep103
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Stephanie Borys presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: China Tonight: Summer Special Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Sam Yang and Annie Louey take a look back at more of our favourite stories from China Tonight in 2023, exploring how technology and culture are changing the face of modern day China.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Peter Maddison meets Michael and Sandy Rutledge, who plan to build a home that is a combination of Old World European and sleek, contemporary style at Gladysdale, east of Melbourne.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - In Adelaide, Mike Dare appoints himself architect, engineer and project manager as he sets about creating a home supported by water tanks with the roof acting like a giant funnel.

programme.title: Outback Musical
programme.desc: Outback students scattered across sheep and cattle properties overcome distance, drought and disability to put on a show from home as they realise their dreams, dancing, bull-riding and lawn bowling towards the big night.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A story of art, fame and family. The late John Olsen, one of our most beloved painters, had an obsessive focus on his work, often casting a shadow on those around him. John and family open up about art and the cost of fame.

programme.title: A Sunburnt Christmas
programme.desc: A family living on an outback farm that has seen hard times suspect there won't be much Christmas joy this year, but when a man dressed as Santa crashes a van of toys onto their property, their world is turned upside down.

programme.title: Built To Survive Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Phil Breslin journeys down Australia's river system by kayak, all the way from the rocky rapids to the wide brown estuaries. Phil encounters a duc-billed platypus, a long-finned eel and a bull shark.

programme.title: Decoding Danger Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - More than any other place on Earth, Australia is a land shaped by fire. As the firestorms that threaten Australia intensify, how can we use science and new technology to stay safe in the future? (Final)

programme.title: The Gospel According To Marcia
programme.desc: Marcia Hines, Australian music legend, sings iconic gospel hits and discusses how her own faith has helped forge 50 years in the music industry. Included are never before heard stories from behind the industry curtain.

programme.title: Danielle's Pacific Break
programme.desc: In the Pacific it's hard for women to launch careers in the music industry, but when singer-songwriter Danielle wins the region's biggest music competition, it kickstarts her breakout year.

programme.title: The Cloud Under The Sea
programme.desc: Lurking under the sea is a global web of fibre optic telecommunication cables, the plumbing of the internet. It's how we talk, text and stream, connecting billions of people. These cables are also the frontline of a tech war.

programme.title: A Sunburnt Christmas
programme.desc: A family living on an outback farm that has seen hard times suspect there won't be much Christmas joy this year, but when a man dressed as Santa crashes a van of toys onto their property, their world is turned upside down.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Peter Maddison meets Laurie Smith and Renee Hoareau, who plan to build a cube-shaped home of steel, stone and glass where they can create and display their artworks at Yellingbo, Victoria.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Greg and Trish's house on Hobart's Battery Point waterfront is in the perfect spot, so they didn't want to go far. They bought an old cottage next door and integrated them into one house with two distinct personalities.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep103
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by David Chau.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A story of art, fame and family. The late John Olsen, one of our most beloved painters, had an obsessive focus on his work, often casting a shadow on those around him. John and family open up about art and the cost of fame.

programme.title: The World This Week Ep49
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Beverley O'Connor brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents across Europe, North America, the Middle East, and the Indo-Pacific. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Danielle's Pacific Break
programme.desc: In the Pacific it's hard for women to launch careers in the music industry, but when singer-songwriter Danielle wins the region's biggest music competition, it kickstarts her breakout year.

programme.title: Bradman And Tendulkar
programme.desc: Two of cricket's greatest players, sporting icons from different corners of the world. This documentary compares their early lives, stellar careers and dreams, uncovering striking similarities and never-before-shared details.

programme.title: Landline: Asia Pacific Special Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Landline visits South-East Asia where a unique charity in Cambodia gives cows to farmers in return for sending their children to school. In Laos a dairy's buffalo rental scheme is helping lift families out of poverty.

programme.title: Back Roads Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 9 - Back Roads heads to one of the country's largest cattle stations, Brunette Downs in the NT. Heather Ewart discovers what makes life on this remote and rugged property so attractive and arrives in time for the Brunette Races.

programme.title: ABC News on Christmas Day Ep21
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Casey Briggs.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Christmas Cracker Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Spend Christmas with your favourite breakfast TV family. Michael Rowland, Lisa Millar, Tony Armstrong, Bridget Brennan and Nate Byrne are joined by some of our regular contributors and special guests for some festive cheer.

programme.title: ABC News on Christmas Day Ep22
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Casey Briggs.

programme.title: Project Wild Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Dr Ann Jones travels through the Indo-Pacific region to find the dedicated people bringing our planet's amazing animals, plants and ecosystems back from the brink. This time she visits biodiversity-rich Cambodia.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Casey Briggs.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Christmas Cracker Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A second helping of festive frivolity as the News Breakfast team bring you more seasonal cheer and Christmas Spirit with a special for the holiday season.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Casey Briggs.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Young people from all across Australia share their personal stories of growing up in regional Australia, as we bring you the best short films from the 2023 Heywire project. Hosted by Isaac Muller.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Casey Briggs.

programme.title: Outback Musical
programme.desc: Outback students scattered across sheep and cattle properties overcome distance, drought and disability to put on a show from home as they realise their dreams, dancing, bull-riding and lawn bowling towards the big night.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by David Chau.

programme.title: A Sunburnt Christmas
programme.desc: A family living on an outback farm that has seen hard times suspect there won't be much Christmas joy this year, but when a man dressed as Santa crashes a van of toys onto their property, their world is turned upside down.

programme.title: The Homes That Built Australia Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Cyclones, floods, droughts; the all-mighty forces of nature devastate our homes and lives, showing how we must design and work with the land - or ignore it at our own peril.

programme.title: Landline Summer Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - This summer, we look back at some of the best Landline stories from 2023. Fighting chemical spray drift in the cotton industry; plus growing more rice using less water.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special Ep18
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look back at some of our favourite stories from the Pacific. We go to Solomon Islands where the legacy of WWII is still felt. Plus we hear from two Pacific music legends Jean Gabilou and American Idol winner Iam Tongi.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Ros Childs.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Christmas Cracker Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Spend Christmas with your favourite breakfast TV family. Michael Rowland, Lisa Millar, Tony Armstrong, Bridget Brennan and Nate Byrne are joined by some of our regular contributors and special guests for some festive cheer.

programme.title: ABC News on Christmas Day Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Ros Childs.

programme.title: The World In 2023 Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - From scientific breakthroughs and stories of survival, to conflict and political upheaval, 2023 was a year like no other. Beverley O'Connor looks back at the big international news stories which shaped The World in 2023.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep10
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Peter Maddison meets Edd and Amanda Williams from Steels Creek in Victoria, who plan to build a robust concrete bunker that would be embedded in the landscape and safe from bushfires.

programme.title: Camel Capers Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - One New South Wales family has a 3 generation connection to camels. Turning 15 is a big deal for Anna Cannard, allowing her to race her three pet camels, and fueling her dreams to turn pro.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Ros Childs.

programme.title: Back Roads Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 9 - Heather Ewart visits the Quilpie shire in outback Queensland. With an average age of under 40, residents have transformed this former Opalopolis into a vibrant community, with a little help from Australia's biggest dinosaur.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep256
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The day's top stories and the latest from ABC News on Christmas Day. Presented by Herlyn Kaur.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep15
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Mick and Jamie bonded over coding as teenagers. Now their brilliant tech idea is transforming lives around the world. Their software could have made them rich but instead they've kept it free to help the blind community.

programme.title: A Sunburnt Christmas
programme.desc: A family living on an outback farm that has seen hard times suspect there won't be much Christmas joy this year, but when a man dressed as Santa crashes a van of toys onto their property, their world is turned upside down.

programme.title: The World In 2023 Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - From scientific breakthroughs and stories of survival, to conflict and political upheaval, 2023 was a year like no other. Beverley O'Connor looks back at the big international news stories which shaped The World in 2023.

programme.title: Alone Australia Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - After ten days in the Tasmanian wilderness, just five participants remain. Having survived the settling in period, each is now focussed on their own strategies, which they hope will see them outstay the others.

programme.title: Aussie Bull Catchers Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - The Cooks double down on their investment with a helicopter. Kurt Hammar's son Kodi leaves school to become a bull catcher. After a nasty spider bite and medical help miles away, Clarry's worker resorts to an old bush remedy.

programme.title: Built To Survive Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Phil Breslin journeys down Australia's river system by kayak, all the way from the rocky rapids to the wide brown estuaries. Phil encounters a duc-billed platypus, a long-finned eel and a bull shark.

programme.desc: Secrets of the Stone Age - Part 1: From Hunters to Farmers - Around 12,000 years ago, humans underwent a transition from the nomadic lifestyle of hunter-gatherers to the settled life of farmers. Part 1 of this two-part documentary illuminates the cultural background of these structures and shows the difficulties Stone Age humans had to contend with.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: Japanology Plus explores Japanese life and culture. In this 5-minute digest, we look at deep-fried food. These mouth-watering Japanese dishes are enjoyed as takeaway items and made at home.

programme.title: A Cat'S-Eye View Of Japan
programme.desc: Head to the famous Todai-ji Temple before visiting a nun's kitty at the 1,300-year-old Chugu-ji Temple. Visit a Japanese washi paper factory and a plum tree grove for more kitty fun.

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.title: Anime Manga Explosion
programme.desc: TMS ENTERTAINMENT, celebrating 60 years in 2024, is known for hits like Lupin the 3rd and Detective Conan. Learn about the production process and initiatives to promote anime industry sustainability.

programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

programme.title: Somewhere Street

programme.title: Taiwan'S Windy Frontline Islands
